CountryData.name: Saint Pierre and Miquelon
CountryData.description: Saint Pierre and Miquelon is an archipelago located in the South Atlantic Ocean, approximately 45 kilometers (28 miles) east of Newfoundland, Canada. It is an overseas territorial collectivity of France, consisting of two main islands, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, and numerous smaller islets. The islands boast a unique blend of French and North American cultures, characterized by a strong maritime tradition and a relaxed pace of life. The landscape is dominated by rolling hills, coastal cliffs, and expansive grasslands, offering stunning views of the Atlantic.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Saint Pierre and Miquelon is relatively small, reflecting its remote location and limited economic opportunities.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides on Miquelon, the larger of the two islands.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The archipelago covers a modest area, contributing to its isolated nature.
quickFacts.detail: Saint Pierre is approximately 78 km² and Miquelon is around 24 km².

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: As part of France, Saint Pierre and Miquelon uses the Euro as its currency.
quickFacts.detail: However, Canadian dollars are also sometimes accepted.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language of Saint Pierre and Miquelon.
quickFacts.detail: English is also spoken, particularly by the fishing community.

quickFacts.label: Time Zone
quickFacts.description: Saint Pierre and Miquelon observes Atlantic Time (AST), which is three hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
quickFacts.detail: During daylight saving time, the time zone shifts to UTC-2.

climateData.title: Maritime Climate
climateData.description: Saint Pierre and Miquelon experiences a cool, maritime climate influenced by the cold waters of the North Atlantic. Summers are mild and relatively short, while winters are long, cold, and often windy.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer brings relatively mild temperatures and longer daylight hours. Rainfall is moderate, and fog is common.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn is characterized by cooler temperatures, increasing wind, and a higher chance of rain. The landscape transforms with vibrant fall foliage.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coldest and wettest season, with frequent snowfall and strong winds. Daylight hours are short.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming trend, with increasing daylight hours and blooming wildflowers. The landscape slowly comes back to life.

naturalWonders.name: Miquelon Pointe
naturalWonders.description: Miquelon Pointe is a dramatic headland on the southwestern tip of Miquelon Island, characterized by towering cliffs, rugged terrain, and a rich birdlife. It offers breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean and is a prime location for observing seabirds.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The cliffs are composed of layered sedimentary rock, showcasing millions of years of geological history. The Pointe is also home to a small, sheltered cove, providing a safe harbor for fishing boats.

naturalWonders.name: Saint Pierre Dunes
naturalWonders.description: The Saint Pierre Dunes are a unique and fragile ecosystem of sand dunes located on the western coast of Saint Pierre Island. These dunes are a result of centuries of wind and wave action, creating a distinctive landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The dunes are covered in a sparse vegetation of grasses and shrubs, adapted to the harsh coastal environment. They provide a habitat for various bird species and other wildlife.
viewingTips: Stay on designated trails to protect the dunes
Be mindful of the fragile ecosystem

ecosystemData.title: Atlantic Coastal Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: The Atlantic coastal ecosystem of Saint Pierre and Miquelon is a dynamic and resilient environment shaped by the forces of the ocean and the surrounding landscape. It supports a diverse range of plant and animal life, including seabirds, marine mammals, and various invertebrates.

biodiversityCategories.name: Seabirds
biodiversityCategories.description: Saint Pierre and Miquelon is a crucial breeding ground for numerous seabird species, attracted by the islands' sheltered waters and abundant fish stocks.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: The surrounding waters are home to various marine mammals, including seals, dolphins, and whales, which rely on the ecosystem for food and breeding.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities
activities.description: Saint Pierre and Miquelon offers a range of outdoor activities for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers, taking advantage of the islands' stunning coastal scenery and diverse wildlife.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands' rolling hills and coastal trails, enjoying panoramic views of the Atlantic Ocean.

activities.name: Coastal Trail Hike
activities.description: Hike along the scenic coastal trails, observing seabirds and marine life.
safety: Be aware of changing weather conditions

activityCategories.name: Birdwatching
activityCategories.description: Observe a wide variety of seabirds, including Northern Gannets, Black-legged Kittiwakes, and various migratory species.

activities.name: Seabird Observation
activities.description: Spend time observing seabirds at Miquelon Pointe and other coastal locations.

activityCategories.name: Boat Trips
activityCategories.description: Take a boat trip to explore the islands' coastline, visit secluded coves, and observe marine wildlife.

activities.name: Coastal Exploration Tour
activities.description: Enjoy a scenic boat tour along the coastline, with opportunities for wildlife viewing.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket and pants, hat, gloves, scarf

safety: Inform someone of your hiking plans
